description: Palindromic primes with just two distinct prime digits.
mathematica: Select[ Range[ 1, 780000000, 2 ], PrimeQ[ # ] && Length[ Union[ IntegerDigits[ # ] ] ] == 2 && IntegerDigits[ # ] == Reverse[ IntegerDigits[ # ] ] && Position[ IntegerDigits[ # ], 0 ] == {} && Position[ IntegerDigits[ # ], 1 ] == {} && Position[ IntegerDigits[ # ], 4 ] == {} && Position[ IntegerDigits[ # ], 6 ] == {} && Position[ IntegerDigits[ # ], 8 ] == {} && Position[ IntegerDigits[ # ], 9 ] == {} & ]
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Dec 18 2000
